context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: Stare decisis, the idea that today's Court should generally stand by yesterday's decisions, is a foundation stone of the rule of law.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: It promotes the evenhanded, predictable, and consistent development of legal doctrine, and it contributes to the actual and perceived integrity of the judicial process, by ensuring that decisions are founded in the law rather than in the proclivities of individuals.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: For those reasons, departures from stare decisis are supposed to be exceptional actions, demanding special justification, but the majority offers nothing like that here.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: The standard factors this Court considers when deciding to overrule a decision, and Justice Alito mentioned them, all cut one-way, against reversal.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: Abood's legal underpinnings have not eroded over time.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: As I have explained, Abood is now, as it was when issued, consistent with this Court's First Amendment public employee law.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: Here, the majority proudly lays claim to its six-year campaign to ban agency fees.

context.text: During this time the majority argues public sector unions were on notice that the Court had misgivings about Abood and that the constitutionality of agency fees was uncertain, and so says the majority, unions should have structured their affairs accordingly.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: But that argument reflects a radically wrong understanding of how stare decisis operates.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan
context.text: Justice Scalia once confronted a similar argument for disregarding reliance interests and showed how antithetical it was to rule of law principles.

context.speaker: Elena Kagan

context.speaker: Elena Kagan

context.text: When Congress enacted 3553(e) -- that was in 1986 -- there were no guidelines -- final guidelines that had been promulgated at that point. context.speaker: Eric J. Feigin

What it allows is a sentence that reflects or takes account of substantial assistance.

Now I do think it's important to recognize, though, that what is the infringing conduct is what ION does in the United States. What the foreign combiners of the components do on the high seas is not infringement of a U.S. patent at all, which is why I think the presumption against extraterritoriality is really a misfit here. context.text: But it's that kind of thing that you'll have to do. So my question is obviously why should we take a system that works fairly well and throw this practical monkey wrench, which means a lot more work for you, into the gears?

context.speaker: Stephen G. Breyer
context.text: Think of a state prisoner who has filed a petition in a federal habeas court and says give me writ of habeas corpus because I am being held unlawfully under federal law?

context.speaker: Stephen G. Breyer
context.text: Now, the habeas statute say that, normally, in order to show that he is being held unlawfully under federal law, he has to show that the state adjudication that says you should be held in person was contrary to or involved in unreasonable application of clearly established federal law or was based upon an unreasonable determination of the facts.

context.speaker: Stephen G. Breyer
context.text: Now, we emphasize that this is only a presumption because the state might provide good reasons for believing that the higher state court in fact rested its holding even though it just said affirmed on a different rationale, but we still think that use of the presumption will prove an efficient way accurately to identify the rationale that did underlie the highest state court's one or two-word disposition of the matter.

context.speaker: Stephen G. Breyer
context.text: We elaborate our reasons further in our opinion.

context.speaker: Stephen G. Breyer
context.text: They are primarily resting on precedent, but because the Eleventh Circuit didn't imply this look-through approach, we reverse its decision and we remand the case for further proceedings.
